content:
Google has been experimenting with new targeted advertising methods in the Chrome browser, intended to replace the cross-site browser cookies that have powered online advertising (and privacy violations) for decades. The company’s latest attempt is the Topics API, which was introduced in January, and now Google is starting to expand it beyond the browser. Google

The post Google releases first Android Privacy Sandbox preview, based on Chrome’s Topics API appeared first on XDA.
description: Google just started testing its new Topics API for targeted ads in Chrome, but it's already coming to Android.
